title: 112_hr6040
content: The Act titled "Continued Free Association with Palau Act of 2012" is cited in Section 1. Section 2 amends Title I of Public Law 99-658 by adding a new section regarding a review agreement for the 15th anniversary of the Compact. The Agreement between the United States and the Republic of Palau, signed in 2010, is approved with exceptions and subject to provisions. Funding provisions for infrastructure maintenance in fiscal year 2011 are outlined. The Agreement between the United States and Palau in fiscal year 2011 includes provisions for funding infrastructure projects in the following years. Congress consents to amendments to Compact subsidiary agreements related to funding postal services for Palau, the Federated States of Micronesia, and the Marshall Islands until 2024. $1.5 million is authorized for each fiscal year from 2012 to 2024 for this purpose, with funds transferable to the United States Postal Service. Congress consents to amendments allowing domestic postage for mail to Palau, the Federated States of Micronesia, and the Marshall Islands until 2024. Appropriations for Compact entities can continue through 2024 for specified purposes. Full faith and credit apply to US commitments under the Compact Review Agreement. The Congress consents to amendments allowing domestic postage for mail to Palau, the Federated States of Micronesia, and the Marshall Islands until 2024. Appropriations for Compact entities can continue through 2024 for specified purposes. Full faith and credit apply to US commitments under the Compact Review Agreement. Section 215 of the Compact shall be applied to commitments and amounts by substituting '2011' for '1981'. The Government of Palau is eligible for certain United States domestic programs, with oversight and annual reporting requirements to Congressional committees. The Secretary of the Interior must provide a report to Congress on the assistance given to Palau under US domestic programs, consulting with relevant federal agencies. Offsets include the repeal of prior authorization for the civil administration of the Trust Territory of the Pacific Islands and a limitation on the use of funds for global health programs under the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961. The text chunk limits funds for global health activities in China and reduces the total amount available by $2,000,000 annually until 2024. It also includes a provision for climate change funds under the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961. The text chunk prohibits funds for climate change activities in China and reduces the total amount available by $4,500,000 annually until 2024. It also includes a provision for the Development Innovation Ventures (DIV) Program under the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961. The text chunk limits funds for the Development Innovation Ventures (DIV) program and reduces the total amount available to the United States Agency for International Development by $28,200,000 annually. It also includes a provision for the IMET program under the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961. The text chunk limits funds for Argentina under the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961, reducing the total amount available by $4,500,000 annually. The text chunk limits funds for Argentina under the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 by reducing the total amount available annually. The text chunk imposes a limitation on funds for United States contributions to UNESCO through fiscal year 2024, reducing the total amount available annually. The text chunk sets a limit on funds for US contributions to UNESCO until 2024, reducing the annual available amount.
